summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the New York Department of State Division of Corporations, dated June 24, 2019, with a rider dated July 10, 2019. It commands the production of incorporation records for two entities, Nine East 71st Street Corporation and Maple, Inc., as part of a criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking and conspiracy. The document includes a cover letter requesting confidentiality and a declaration form for a custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the cover letter requesting confidentiality for the grand jury subpoena issued to the New York Department of State.

persons.name: Geoff E. Becan
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena dated July 10, 2019, commanding the production of records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which the New York Department of State is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena and its rider were issued, commanding the production of corporate records for specific entities.

keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement).
The investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, indicating an active probe into potential sex trafficking and related conspiracies.
The subpoena specifically targets corporate records for 'Nine East 71st Street Corporation' and 'Maple, Inc.', entities potentially linked to Jeffrey Epstein's network of properties and businesses.
The U.S. Attorney's office explicitly requests confidentiality, asking the recipient not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to preserve the investigation's integrity.
The document shows the investigation was active in mid-2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019 and his death in August 2019.
